b.gui

Class Drink

  • java.lang.Object
    • b.gui.Drink

  • public class Drink
extends java.lang.Object
    This object represents a drink item.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<Ingredient> ingredients 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Drink()
      Default constructor, used when information about a drink is not yet known.
      Drink(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<Ingredient> ingredients, java.lang.Float cost)
      Initializes the drink with specified information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToDatabase()
      This queries the database to add this drink to the database as a new entry.
      void Copy(Drink d)
      Copies the data from the specified drink to this drink.
      void deleteFromDatabase()
      This queries the database to remove this drink's entry.
      java.lang.Boolean hasIngredient(Ingredient ingr)
      This shows if a drink contains a specified ingredient.
      void updateDatabase()
      This queries the database to update the current drink's entry with any changes made.

        name - The name of the drink.
        ingredients - The ingredients within the drink.

    • Method Detail

      • addToDatabase

        public void addToDatabase()
        This queries the database to add this drink to the database as a new entry.

      • updateDatabase

        This queries the database to update the current drink's entry with any changes made.

      • deleteFromDatabase

        public void deleteFromDatabase()
        This queries the database to remove this drink's entry.

      • hasIngredient

        public java.lang.Boolean hasIngredient(Ingredient ingr)
        This shows if a drink contains a specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        ingr - The ingredient to search for.
        Returns:
        True if the drink has the specified ingredient.
